body: Barbados Free Press and Barbados Underground are outraged that a dangerous precedent has been set by the Director of Public Prosecutions' recent decision to "[drop] a charge of murder to manslaughter because the murdered woman had refused sex and therefore 'provoked' her killer."
original_body: Barbados Free Press and Barbados Underground are outraged that a dangerous precedent has been set by the Director of Public Prosecutions' recent decision to "[drop] a charge of murder to manslaughter because the murdered woman had refused sex and therefore 'provoked' her killer."
title: Barbados: "Provoked" to Murder?

sentence: Barbados Free Press and Barbados Underground are outraged that a dangerous precedent has been set by the Director of Public Prosecutions' recent decision to "[drop] a charge of murder to manslaughter because the murdered woman had refused sex and therefore 'provoked' her killer."
